questions.text: This man was first mentioned in Exodus 4:14 of the KJV. His sister was Miriam, his brother was Moses. Who was he?
questions.explanation:
Aaron.

	Aaron acted as the voice for Moses because Moses was "slow of speech" (Exodus 4:10). Later Aaron, a Levite, became the first priest.

questions.text: Only mentioned in Esther 1:10 of the KJV, this was one of the men in King Ahasuerus' court. Who was he?
questions.explanation:
Abagtha.

	Abagtha was a eunuch. His name means "God-given". He and the six others in the court suggested Queen Vashti parade before the king and his workers. The king thought it was a good idea. However, when Vashti refused she was kicked out of the kingdom.

questions.text: "Abba" is first mentioned in Mark 14:36 in the KJV, "And he said, Abba, Father, all things are possible unto Thee; take away this cup from me; nevertheless not what I will but what Thou wilt." Who is speaking here?
questions.explanation:
Jesus.

	This is Jesus' famous prayer in Gethsemane. He knew He didn't have much longer until he would be crucified. Crucifixion is considered to be one of the worst ways to die, so Jesus is asking His Father (Abba), God, if there be another way. But then He tells God, He will do it God's way.

questions.text: Azariah's name was changed to this Babylonian name in Daniel 1:7 of the King James Version. What is this Babylonian name?
questions.explanation:
Abednego.

	In chapter 3 of Daniel, Abednego was one of the three men thrown into the fiery furnace because he refused to bow down to an idol. However, the three men did not burn, because the Angel of the Lord was in there with them and saved them.

questions.text: The first time this word is used in its base-form (that is without a suffix or prefix) in the KJV is Leviticus 26:11. What is this word that means hate?
questions.explanation:
abhor.

	God is speaking in this verse and telling the people, "I shall not abhor you." The word abhor is mentioned 18 times in the Bible - 17 times in the Old Testament and once in the New Testament.

Ahasuerus.

	There was more than one king Ahasuerus. This king first mentioned in Esther 1:1 "reigned from India even unto Ethiopia, over an hundred and seven and twenty provinces."

questions.text: Who was Ahab's son who succeeded him according to 1 Kings 22:40 of the KJV?
questions.explanation:
Ahaziah.

	According to 1 Kings 22:51 he reigned for two years. At the time of his reign over Samaria, Jehoshaphat ruled over Judah.

questions.text: According to 1 Chronicles 13:7 this is one of the men who moved the "ark of God". Who was this A-man?
questions.explanation:
Ahio.

	Ahio means his brother or his brethren. He was the son of Abinadab. He was a Benjamite.

questions.text: Who was Shamgar's father, according to Judges 3:31 of the KJV?
questions.explanation:
Anoth.

	The name Anoth is related to the Phoenician and Canaanite goddess "Anat". She was also worshipped in Egypt. Shamgar, his son, killed 600 Philistines with an ox goad according to Judges 3:31.

questions.text: Ants are mentioned one time in the King James Version of the Holy Bible. Where is this found?
questions.explanation:
Proverbs 30:25.

	Proverbs 30:25 says, "The ants are a people not strong, yet they prepare their meat in the summer." Ants are known for being hard workers, and despite how small they are, they can accomplish a lot.
